intro: Cliffortia aequatorialis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Ecuador. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, where it forms dense mats or small shrubs. Its flowers are white or pale blue, with five petals and a distinctive hooded structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
